This is what you missed while you were sleeping last night. This May Be Why We Recall Some Dreams (Especially Bad Ones) Studies open new ground in the search for clues to how the dreaming brain works.
Does your true personality emerge in your dreams? 3 Things Your Dreams May Reveal About You New research sheds light on who we are while we sleep.

Pregnancy isn't always a dream. But for some women, it's literally a nightmare. Why Pregnant Women Have Bizarre Bad Dreams New research on the surprising frequency of disturbing dreams during pregnancy.

Ever wonder how scenes from your life make it into your dreams? We're finally figuring it out. How Your Dreams Really Work New research uncovers why we dream what we dream, and when we're likely to dream it.
Have you ever had this uncanny (and unsettling) experience? When Two People Dream the Same Dream Despite many convincing reports, we're just beginning to find out how it could possibly happen.

Dreaming that a partner is unfaithful can lead to some real-life problems when you wake up. What It Means When You Have a Bad Dream About Your Partner Accurate or not, nightmares about your partner can be bad for your relationship.
When you have dreams of being judged harshly, does it mean you need to make a change? What 3 Common Bad Dreams Could Be Telling You How daytime stress creeps into your nightmares.
Is the same cast starring in your dreams each night? This may be why. What Your Sexual Dreams Are Trying to Tell You Expert insight into who, and what, we dream about, and why.

What makes you remember a dream? New research is bringing us closer to an answer. Why Do Some People Recall Lots of Dreams, While Others Never Do? Is it possible that the people who remember more dreams just have more interesting dreams?
Can a dream about everyone's worst nightmare actually be a good thing? What Dreams of Your Death Are Really About “The most striking and consistent characteristic is overwhelmingly pleasant content."

What happens to you while you sleep can change what's happening in your dreams. Why the Characters in Your Dreams (Including You) Do What They Do ... and why sometimes you believe you're a character other than yourself.
Is a bad dream disturbing you night after night? Here's how to beat it. 5 Ways to Hack Your Nightmares 3. Instead of replaying a bad dream in your head, give it a new script.

What if we could capture the dreams of millions, and keep them in a database? In the 1950s, someone actually tried. The Dream Catchers An ambitious, nearly-forgotten project decades ahead of its time but with very modern dilemmas.
The issues you avoid during the day can plague you while you sleep. Here's why. Why Unwanted Thoughts Can Invade Your Dreams New research into why we really dream about the things we do.
If you commit a violent act while you dream, should you be held responsible? Are We Responsible for Our Violent Dreams? A famous case raises unsettling questions about our intentions.

Your nightmares could help you find the answers you've always dreamed of. How Bad Dreams Can Help You Solve Your Problems There are good nightmares, and there are bad nightmares. Here's the difference.

Here's what we know, and what we don't know, about what happens when the lights go out. 12 Most Commonly Asked Questions About Dreams, Answered What are your dreams trying to tell you, and what if you can't remember them?
You have more control over your dreams than you think. What'll it be tonight? How to Direct Your Dreams When your eyes close, choose your own adventure.
Do your dreams matter? Maybe more than you ever imagined. 6 Ways That Tonight's Dreams Could Change Your Life Reconnecting with your past and finding the keys to your future.
Have you ever had any of these bad dreams? Are Your Worst Nightmares Also Everyone Else's? Some bad dreams keep coming back, again and again.
We're getting closer to solving one of life's greatest mysteries. Why Do We Dream? New insights into what really goes on when we drift into sleep.
Did you have a bizarre dream last night? Maybe it was something you ate. Do Certain Foods Really Cause Bad Dreams? New research investigates age-old folklore about diet and sleep.
What was in your dreams last night, and how did it get there? Why We Dream What We Dream An expert guide to what goes on behind the wall of sleep.
Do you ever have dreams whose stories continue from night to night? This is why. Why Some of Your Dreams Have Sequels Do our dreams pursue their own interests, and just take us along for the ride?
Your dreams may be trying to tell you more than you realize. Do Your Dreams Predict Your Health? Pay attention: Research finds some dreams can forecast illness years in advance.
Can you remember what you dreamed last night? How Our Dreams Influence Our Days New research into who remembers dreams, and how our dreams affect us.
Have you ever had the same dream over and over again? Here's why. What's Behind Your Recurring Dreams Why dreams generated by long-ago stress can keep coming back.
Can you control your dreams? Is Conscious Dreaming Real? Lucid dreaming remains a controversial concept but some experts are convinced.
The dreams you dream tonight will do more for your mind and body than you might imagine. What Do Dreams Do for Us? 5 answers to an eternal question.
You may be able to control what you'll dream about tonight. Can Our Dreams Solve Problems While We Sleep? Remarkable new evidence of the power of 'dream telepathy.'
What did you dream about last night, and what does it say about your brain? How We Decode Dreams Today Fascinating new research shows what our brain is really up to while we sleep.
Will you dream about your significant other tonight?  How Your Dreams Can Affect Your Love Life Relationship advice you can follow in your sleep.
How fantasies shape your future. Dreams of Glory A key to creativity that everyone possesses.

Are your daytime worries creeping into your dreams? Here's a way to rethink stressful nightmares: http://ow.ly/qTeJY Conquer Your Bad Dreams by Confronting Your Worries Stop negative emotions from spilling into your dreams and becoming nightmares
Isn't it odd that awesome speeches, cold showers and a good scare all give us the same thing—goosebumps? Goosebumps and Dr. King's Dream Speech Why does Dr. King's Dream speech give us goosebumps?

"The dreams and desires we have as children create echoes and shadows that preoccupy us for a lifetime."
 http://ow.ly/nDSSL The Possibilities of Fiction We dream up alternative universes as we continue to invent ourselves.
Longer Life Through Sexbots? http://ow.ly/hxHgn Longer life through sexbots? Dream on! Research linking sex with longevity has led to some wildly exaggerated claims.

Fact: You can control your dreams. Myth: Dreams are filled with symbolism. 

Click through for more sleep myths & facts. Seize Control of Your Dreams Four myths and one surprising fact about sleep

A debate is raging among psychologists about whether they should diagnose the president, and if so, with what? Should Psychologists Diagnose President Trump? Calling out a narcissistic leader, or doing a disservice to the field?
Narcissists think they're pretty great, but not at everything. Why Narcissists Think They're Better Than You New research on grandiosity and the Lake Wobegon effect.
Do you recognize any of these signs? 7 Things Only Narcissists Do 6. They assume everyone adores them.
Sometimes, narcissists don't reveal their true selves until they face a conflict. 4 Behaviors That Unmask a Hidden Narcissist 3. They're vindictive to the max.
When a narcissist gives you a present, it's really a gift to themselves. Beware of Narcissists Bearing Gifts Their apparent generosity may stem from a desire to maintain control.
When you see the signs, do you know what to do? 5 Types of Toxic People You Need Out of Your Life The critic, the stonewaller, the narcissist, and more.

A malignant narcissist makes breaking up especially hard to do. Here's why. Why It's So Hard to End a Relationship with a Narcissist As things start to unravel, they may become destructive to themselves and others.

Forget what you've heard. This is what narcissism really is (and what it definitely isn't). Meet the Real Narcissists. (They're Not What You Think.) ... and why everyone is more narcissistic at 19 than they are at 40.
What happens when a narcissist has to face reality? When the Narcissist's Bubble Bursts ... and why experts say that even the most self-absorbed can adjust and accept their true selves.
When dealing with a narcissist, the environment can quickly grow toxic. This is how to protect yourself. 5 Tips for Interacting With a Narcissist 1. Always focus on the bigger picture.

Yes, it's possible to have a successful relationship with a narcissist. But it comes at a cost. What Kind of Romantic Partners Make Narcissists Happy? Is it someone who makes them feel good, or someone who makes them look good?
A narcissist can sweep you off your feet. After that ... How a Narcissist Can Derail You ... and how to recognize the admirable traits that could make you vulnerable.
Have you ever encountered someone with this disturbing personality? The Link Between Narcissism and Sadism What drives a troubling narcissistic subtype, and how to recognize it.
Narcissists may not be what they initially seem. What Really Makes Narcissists Tick? ... and how deserving are they of our sympathy?
This is how a narcissist approaches a breakup—and how you should respond. 13 Things You Must Know if You Are Leaving a Narcissist 3. They don't feel emotional losses.
Are narcissists angrier than other people? Yes and no. What Makes Narcissists Angry (and Why) New research into anger style and instincts for revenge.
You want everyone you know to hear your good news. Does that make you a narcissist? Is It Wrong to Want to Be Admired? What research into healthy and unhealthy narcissism tells us about our egos.
9 rules for raising a child with a narcissistic ex. Forget Co-Parenting with a Narcissist. Do This Instead. 2. Establish firm boundaries.
Narcissistic people really do think they're pretty hot. Here's the proof. What Narcissists See in the Mirror They see someone who's off-the-charts superior to others. But why?
Are narcissists born or made? New theories on the trait explain it may be a bit of both. How Narcissists Got That Way Nature, nurture, and evolution combine for a toxic result.

Can a narcissist also be a do-gooder? Oh, yes. And you probably know one. Meet the 'Communal' Narcissist Researchers identify a group that seems helpful and understanding, but are only looking out for Number One.

If you're the close friend of a narcissist, does that make you one, too? Do Narcissists of a Feather Flock Together? Research reveals the one (or maybe two) personality types that actually enjoy friendships with narcissists.
Read this before you label anyone else a "narcissist." Who Are You Calling a Narcissist? Are we experiencing a narcissism "epidemic"? Or is something else going on?
What do narcissistic women want? The same things as narcissistic men. Your Field Guide to the Femme Fatale First of its kind research on the sexual strategies of the female narcissist.
This is how narcissists often trip themselves up. Narcissism and the Myth of Invincibility When you think you can't lose, that outcome is all but assured.
How can we tell who's really a narcissist? It's harder than you think. Everything You Always Wanted to Know About Narcissism An expert weighs in on some crucial misunderstandings.
We're in the middle of a narcissism epidemic? Are you sure about that? 3 Dangerous Myths About Narcissists They're not exactly who you think they are, because you may be looking for the wrong traits.

A lot of what we think we know about narcissists just isn't quite right. 9 Myths about Narcissism Almost Everyone Believes (and Why They're Wrong) Think there's nothing healthy about narcissism? Think again.
We mistakenly label a lot of people as 'narcissists.' Here's why. Narcissist or Just Self-Centered? 4 Ways to Tell Who You're Dealing With ... including the one core difference.

Turns out, there's something you can learn from (healthy) narcissists. How Narcissists Really React When Things Don’t Go Their Way ... because they know raging at the world doesn't make you look very good.
You don't have to be a narcissist to react like one when you face rejection. Why Love Can Turn Into Rage ... and how to adopt a mindset that will avoid blowups.
Have you or a friend ever dated a narcissist? Who Falls for Dishonest People? Not Who You'd Expect Learn to recognize the traits that could make you vulnerable.

Are you guilty of 'diagnosing' too many people as narcissists? Why We Need to Stop Throwing the 'Narcissist' Label Around There are some dangerous individuals in the world. Give everyone else a break.
Could you be one and not even realize it? Do Narcissists Know They Are Narcissists?  Surprising research on what they know about themselves and how others see them.
Don't judge narcissists by their words alone. What We All Get So Wrong About Narcissists Å new study throws doubt on what we think we know about narcissism.

A narcissistic personality can take a devastating toll on a relationship. Find out if yours is at risk. Is Your Partner a Narcissist? Here Are 50 Ways to Tell. An expert's checklist for gauging where you stand.
All narcissists are not prone to cheat. But this group is. Why Sexual Narcissists Make Unfaithful Partners New research into why some partners are prone to stray.
Is there a narcissist in your life? 10 Signs That You're in a Relationship with a Narcissist Be on the lookout for these, before you get manipulated.
It just got a lot easier to figure out who's a narcissist. The One Question That Can Tell Us Who's a Narcissist A new study finds a surprising insight about personality.
Are there more narcissists than ever? Let's consider the evidence. Is There Really an Epidemic of Narcissism? A meme may not hold up to close scrutiny.

New research shows what drives some of the most difficult people in your life. Narcissists Need to Love Themselves More, Not Less Why they react to conflict very differently than others, and why it matters.
There may be hope for some narcissists after all. Can We Teach Narcissists to Care? New studies show there may be a way to guide them toward empathy.
At home, at work, or in a relationship, dealing with a narcissist takes work. Here's a guide. 8 Ways to Handle a Narcissist How to keep your own emotions in check when dealing with difficult people.
New research explains why things go wrong when your partner is a narcissist. Could You Be Dating a Narcissist? 5 warning signs to watch for in any relationship.
Admit it: When it comes to our team, town, or tribe, we're all narcissists. The Narcissist In All Of Us Group pride can be a beautiful thing, until it turns dark.
Do you recognize any of these 12 effects of having a narcissist in the family? The Narcissistic Family Tree It can be pretty and decayed at the same time
Narcissists may demand that you look and act perfectly, at least around them. Here's why. Why It's So Hard to Live With Narcissists A new study highlights the pressure they can put on their partners.
Are narcissists really better lovers? Why We Fall for Narcissists A body of research reveals the appeal of cads, and how we can evade them.
Do you think you, or someone you love, is with a narcissist? This can help. 7 Strategies for Dealing With the Narcissist in Your Life Be honest with yourself while you see if change is possible.
If you're in a relationship with a narcissist, you have options. I Love a Narcissist, Now What to Do? Trying to change someone is rarely the best approach.
Parents who spank their kids do a world of damage they may never see. What Really Hurts When Parents Hit Their Kids Definitive new research on the long-term effects of spanking on kids and adults.

Parents who are being bullied by their kids need to retake control. The consequences if they can’t are grim. 4 Ways Parents Can Respond When Their Kids Bully Them … and what the future holds if they fail.
When parents get pushed by their kids, their 3 most common responses all backfire. Here's why. 3 Mistakes Parents Make When Their Kids Bully Them 1. Never surrender.
Is it fair to single out our parents as the people most responsible for our problems? Who Ruined Your Life? A (mostly) tongue-in-cheek look at seven prime suspects.

Is Santa a threat to kids' psyches, or to their relationship with their parents? See what the evidence says. Why It's OK for Kids to Believe in Santa Claus ... and what really happens when they figure out the truth.
When you're raised by a narcissistic parent, the damage may last a lifetime. 8 Common Effects of Narcissistic Parenting Chronic self-blame, "echoism," and more.

Any parent can be tempted to use violence to control a child. Here's proof that they shouldn't. This Is What Really Happens When Parents Spank Their Kids Definitive new research reveals the long- and short-term impact on children, and it's not pretty.
Ever suspect that your parents had a favorite child? New research says your hunch was probably right. Do All Parents Play Favorites? ... and what it might mean for the less-favored kids.
The surprising data on single parents, dating, and sexual activity proves many of our assumptions wrong. Sex and the Single Parent How (and why) they find the time to parent and find a partner.

When parents and adult children are estranged, the loss is never far from the surface. The Stigma of Family Estrangement New research into why parents and children split and how it impacts them long-term.

When did parents become so obsessed with making their children "unique"? New research has the answer. Why So Many Parents Insist on Giving Their Babies Unusual Names Commonality is out, and individualism is in. Here's why.
Authentic parents don't push their expectations. They're excited to meet an original person. 3 Things Authentic Parents Get Right 1. They show interest.

When a parent is unloving, a child can come to believe the worst about themselves. Why It's So Hard to See This Insidious Form of Childhood Abuse ... and why it's so easy for a parent to "gaslight" a child.

Any parent can be tempted to use violence to control a child. Here's proof of why they shouldn't. This Is What Really Happens When Parents Spank Their Kids Definitive new research reveals the long- and short-term impact on children, and it's not pretty.

There's a reason why living with parents has suddenly become so popular, one the experts tend to ignore. Why So Many Young Adults Live With Their Parents (It's Not Just the Economy.) Examining a historic shift in American society.

When you see a child pushing his or her parents around, this may be what's really going on. 3 Reasons Why Parents Let Their Kids Bully Them Patterns formed in childhood that are especially hard to break.

Will today's kids become a generation of narcissists? Not if parents make one key change. How to Raise a Narcissist (and How Not To) The crucial difference between feeling worthy and feeling superior.

You want to treat all of your kids equally. Your parents probably meant to do the same. But it just might not be possible. Can Parents Devote Themselves Equally to All Their Children? One expert says it may be impossible. Here's why.

Do you know parents who seem to get pushed around by their own kids? There’s more to it than meets the eye. The 3 Types of Children Who Bully Their Own Parents … and the good news and bad news about dealing with each.

Do you know a parent who gets pushed around by their kids (or do you face it at home)? This is what's behind it. The 3 Types of Parents Who Get Bullied By Their Own Children ... and some expert advice on stopping the cycle.
We harshly judge an adult child who cuts off a parent. Should we? Should You Ever Divorce a Parent? Challenging stereotypes when enough is enough.
When it comes to raising happy kids, we may be doing it all wrong. The Decline of Play and Rise in Children's Mental Disorders There's a reason kids are more anxious and depressed than ever.

What's the matter with kids today? Plenty. But experts say it all starts with a disturbing lack of grit. Declining Student Resilience: A Serious Problem for Colleges Kids who get to college without learning how to deal with setbacks, an expert says, are forcing us to become a 'helicopter society.'
Sure, a lot of parents hover over their kids. But there's a good reason. Why We Should Give 'Helicopter Parents' a Break ... and what needs to change for the trend to stop.
It's worse than you think. Screentime Is Making Kids Moody, Crazy, and Lazy 6 ways that heavy electronics use impacts kids, and why some desperately need a 'fast.'

Do you know parents who will accept nothing but the best from their kids? This is how they go wrong. The High Price of Pushing Kids Too Hard Children need to know that love is rooted in who they are, not what they do.

Should we listen to kids more, or do we need a return to the days of "be seen and not heard"? Do Today's Parents Give Kids Too Much Say, or Not Enough? Giving children more respect, even as they seem more entitled than ever.

Being the favorite child isn't all it's cracked up to be. (And if you play favorites with your kids, read on.) 4 Reasons Why Being Your Parent's Favorite Can Hold You Back ... and why the effects last so long, and impact the next generation.
There's no better way to communicate. Why You Should Kiss More It's healthy, it's bonding (and it's a great example for the kids).
Do you say it? Was it ever said to you? One Phrase We Should All Stop Saying to Kids Today ... and an expert's suggestions for constructive alternatives.

'Good enough' parents may produce more resilient kids than 'super' parents, according to new research. Are Helicopter Parents Producing a Generation of Needy Kids? ... and if so, an expert asks, how will those kids survive college?

Raising kids is a tough job for anyone, but for some parents, it's even tougher. The 3 Types of Parents Most Likely to Become Bitter ... especially when their communities don't recognize their challenges.

When we get mad at our kids, it's hardly ever about them. Here's what's really going on. Why Parents Really Get Angry at Their Kids (and Why It's Pointless) Kids do exactly what they're meant to do, and expert says. Our response is the problem.
More people spank their kids than you think, and it's partly because they believe these 10 things. Is Spanking Bad for Children and Families? Well, then, why do 4 out of 5 American parents spank?

Why are so many college kids struggling? According to the research, it could be their parents' fault. Are Helicopter Parents Making Kids More Needy? An expert weighs in on how the dynamic plays out in college.
Are you a narcissistic parent, or were you raised by one? 6 Things Narcissistic Parents Do 5. They really, really care about the name of the college their kid gets into.
When a child comes out as transgender, a parent has to make a transition as well. Here's how one mother handled it. When a Son Becomes a Daughter Acknowledging a loss, but reveling in a child's gain.
Parents want to love their children. But sometimes something holds them back. 8 Reasons Parents Fail to Love Their Kids The issues past, present, and even future that limit parental love.
What your parents think they know about you is very likely wrong. Here's why. Parents Just Don't Understand The science behind all parents' misperceptions about their kids.
We harshly judge any adult child who cuts off a parent. Should we? Should You Ever Divorce a Parent? Challenging stereotypes when enough is enough.
Do we really grow up and become our parents? In some ways, yes. 7 Ways Your Childhood Affects How You'll Parent ... and how you can break the cycle.
First, don't ever demand that your kids behave better than you do. 8 Simple Truths for Raising Happy, Successful Kids Learned behaviors can be unlearned, but it has to start with you.

Should parents worry about their kids becoming sexual deviants as soon as they step on a college campus? The Hype and the Reality of Hooking Up at College A report from the inside on what's really going on, and what it means.
Smartphones have handed parents a new, and shocking, means of punishing kids. The 21st-Century Way to Punish Kids (and Why It Would Stun Your Parents) Losing dessert? That's nothing.
Love your partner, but not their pet? Here's what to do. 5 Ways to Make Peace with Your Partner's Pet Animals can be even more resistant to 'step parents' than kids are.
Parents aren't supposed to have a favorite child. But do you have a favorite parent? Which Parent do You Love More? Research into the varied reasons we may grow to prefer Mom's or Dad's company.
Does this description apply to your parents? Are All Parents Narcissistic? ... and is that actually a bad thing? Recent research offers some new insights.
Do we all really end up marrying someone who's just like one of our parents? Why Your Partner May Be Like Your Parent Is your childhood wrecking your romantic life?
We can't watch over kids 24/7. So how can we really enforce rules?  Banning Kids From Having Smartphones Misses the Point Why new guidelines are destined to fail.

A love chemical? Sounds pretty great, but your relationship with your parents can make it harder to wield. The Problems With the Love Hormone How oxytocin is shaped by your parents and wrecks your relationships.
There are psychological benefits to believing in You-Know-Who. When, if at all, should parents break the truth? The Truth About Santa Parents' guilt and the benefits of letting kids believe.
Kids need praise—but it's better to give them an A for effort than for being smart. Should Parents Praise Their Children? Yes, children need praise. Here's why.

"Don’t ever call your adolescent 'lazy.' This label is more psychologically and socially loaded than most parents seem to understand." When Parents Call Their Adolescent Lazy No good comes from parents calling their adolescent "lazy"

"Taking all the discomfort, disappointment and even the play out of [childhood], especially while increasing pressure for success, turns out to be misguided. With few challenges all their own, kids are... robbed of identity, meaning and a sense of accomplishment, to say nothing of a shot at real happiness. Whether we want to or not, we're on our way to creating a nation of wimps." A Nation of Wimps Parents are going to ludicrous lengths to take the bumps out of  life for their children. However, parental hyperconcern has the net  effect of...

"Yes, parents may be too indulgent. More fundamentally, we are too stressed—more burdened and more alone. Both children and parents now have fewer places to turn when they are in need of practical and emotional support." In Defense of Parents Are modern parents too indulgent? Or are we too stressed?

Can being grateful stop your kids from being violent? Scientific evidence suggests it can. http://ow.ly/h68T3 Grateful Kids Flourish, But Are They Also Less Violent? The role of gratitude in social harmony

What can we learn about parenting from someone who has been both a father and a mother? Does Having a Transgender Parent Make Sons into Better Men? After six years as a mother, twelve as a father, a parent climbs a mountain.

Sometimes the twentysomethings who adults worry about the most turn out to have the happiest, most interesting lives. The Long & Winding Road to Adulthood Parents worrying about their twentysomething kids is nothing new.
There are some things kids don't need to hear from their parents. http://ow.ly/ectVV Mom and Dad and TMI: Are You an Over-Sharer? Children are terrible at keeping secrets.
Why are American kids becoming less creative? As Children’s Freedom Has Declined, So Has Their Creativity New research suggests that American schoolchildren are becoming less creative.

"Seeing married life as an escape is like seeing a circus as a great place to take a nap." Is Getting Married Easier Than Going to Work? Neither of my parents thought my mother should have a job. Her life wasn't easy.

Good parenting is not about time spent breastfeeding or leading the PTA. It's much simpler than that. 

Read on for 10 things that (actually) make a good parent—and let us know your thoughts in the comments. Got Good Parenting? It's Not Just about Breast Milk or Extracurricular... What does it take to be a successful parent?

What happens after sex may reveal more about your relationship than what happens during sex. The Psychology of Sexual "Afterglow" ... and why the good feelings might last longer for some couples than for others.
Is "make-up sex" a myth? How Anger Can Ruin a Couple's Sex Life Ever been told, "Don't go to bed angry"? This is why.
Better sex has little to do with devices, positions, or workouts. It has everything to do with this. 10 Steps to a Better Sex Life 9. Don’t have sex when you don’t want to.
Sex can make you smarter, and that's just for starters. 7 Reasons You Should Have More Sex Intimacy with your partner satisfies a host of vital psychological needs.
Do young people today really have more casual sex than their parents did? The Shocking Truth About Hook-Ups and Casual Sex New research disproves a range of myths about modern sex.
The key to great sex isn't technique. It's this. The Surprising Secret to a Better Sex Life (and Relationship) ... and the 3 questions every couple must ask each other.
It has little to do with their parents, or their sex-ed classes. The Top Reasons Why Teens Decide Not to Have Sex ... and why so many are so proud of their choice.
1. Men always crave sex more than women do. 4 Common Myths About Sex and Desire (and the Surprising Truth) Think it's abnormal to desire a dominant partner (or to be one)? Think again.
Is there a secret to keeping things from getting "complicated"? The Sex Test Why do so many relationships derail when sex enters the equation? It may not be why you think.

Do teens who start having sex early really face psychological risks? New research finally provides some answers. Is There a Right Age to Begin Having Sex? The risks, and some potential benefits, of having one's sexual debut unusually early or late.

Research into sexual fantasies proves that most of us are more interested in "atypical" sex than we admit. When It Comes to Sex, What's Really 'Normal'? The reality, some experts argue, is that 'vanilla' sex may be the least 'normative' of all.

A surprising number of adults live happily, and have great relationships, without ever thinking about having sex. Living Happily Ever After, and Never, Ever Having Sex Individuals with no interest in sex argue that they represent a fourth sexual orientation. The experts say they may be right.
When it comes to sex, is more always better? How Many Sex Partners Does It Take to Be Happy? A survey of recent research examines the causes and consequences of a person’s number of sexual partners.
Are young people today having sex earlier than ever? Here are the facts. The Truth About Teens and Sex …and the one factor tied to virginity loss a stunning two years earlier than average.

Contrary to popular belief, the younger generation appears to be having less sex than their parents did at the same age. But why? Why Young People Aren't Having as Much Sex as They Used To Millennials and their younger siblings may be too distracted, too nervous, or just lacking a place to hook up.
This is what's really happening when we swipe right. The Surprising Truth About Why People Use Tinder "Hookup" apps aren't just about sex. For some, they're not even about sex at all.
